Class Server

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
RMIServer, ServerInterface, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class Server extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RMIServer, Runnable, ServerInterface
The main server class responsible for handling incoming RMI and Socket connections, managing connected clients via ClientHandler instances, and overseeing active game instances managed by Controller objects. It implements the RMIServer interface to allow RMI clients to connect and Runnable to run the main server loop (specifically for socket connections). It also implements ServerInterface to provide core server functionalities to other components like ClientHandler.
Version:
1.2
Author:
Giacomo Amaducci
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server() throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new Server instance.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs during object export.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the main server loop, setting up both the RMI registry and the Socket server. The RMI server is bound to a specific port and name. The Socket server listens for incoming connections on a different port, creating a new ClientHandler for each incoming socket connection and starting a thread to handle it. This method is intended to be run in its own thread.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during RMI setup or socket operations.

    • connect

      public void connect(RMIVirtualClient client) throws RemoteException
      Accepts an incoming connection from an RMI client. This method is called remotely by an RMI client via the RMIServer interface. It creates a ClientHandler for the RMI client, adds it to the list of clients, sets the handler on the client's remote object, and starts the handler's thread.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface RMIServer
      Parameters:
      client - The RMIVirtualClient remote reference that acts as a proxy to the connected RMI client.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a communication problem occurs during the RMI call or during the creation/export of the ClientHandler.

    • getActiveGames

      public List<GenericGameData> getActiveGames()
      Retrieves a list of data for all currently active games.
      Specified by:
      getActiveGames in interface ServerInterface
      Returns:
      A List of GenericGameData objects, each containing summary information about an active game. Access to the controller's map is synchronized.

    • setUsername

      public boolean setUsername(ClientHandler client, String username)
      Sets the username for a given client handler if the desired username is unique.
      Specified by:
      setUsername in interface ServerInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The ClientHandler for which the username is to be set.
      username - The desired username.
      Returns:
      true if the username was successfully set (i.e., it was unique), false otherwise. Access to the client's list is synchronized.

    • addPlayerToGame

      public void addPlayerToGame(ClientHandler client, UUID gameId) throws GameFullException
      Adds a player (represented by their ClientHandler) to a specific game.
      Specified by:
      addPlayerToGame in interface ServerInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The ClientHandler of the player to add.
      gameId - The UUID of the game to join.
      Throws:
      GameFullException - If the game identified by gameId is already full. Access to the controller's map is synchronized.

    • createNewGame

      public UUID createNewGame(int players, int level)
      Creates a new game instance with the specified number of players and game level. A unique UUID is generated for the new game.
      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface ServerInterface
      Parameters:
      players - The maximum number of players for the new game.
      level - The difficulty level for the new game.
      Returns:
      The UUID of the newly created game. Access to the controller's map is synchronized.
